title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Greffes du Rosiers [Grafting Roses], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]", 1821–24
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white graphite, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and blue ink on mount, lower center:  Les Greffes du Rosiers
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: Scene in a rose garden in front of a half-timbered building.  A gardener, center foreground, applies a substance to a cut on a rose stem.  A woman beside him, at left, holds a container of this substance.  Another gardener, right middleground, ties a rose graft to a vertical rose stem, assisted by a little boy, to the left, who points to a bucket of rose branches.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Greffes du Rosiers [Grafting Roses], from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]", 1821–24. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white graphite, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper. 1989-13-4.
